description: Mexico extradited 29 people accused of drug trafficking and other crimes to face charges in the US as it tries to meet President Donald Trump’s conditions to avoid tariffs.
title: Mexico Extradites Dozens of Drug Traffickers After Trump Tariff Threat

description: Alberta, Canada’s top oil-producing province, is projecting its first budget deficit after four years of surpluses as the prospect of a trade war with the US weighs on the outlook for economic growth and oil revenue.
title: Canada’s Oil Heartland Sees Trade War Sparking Budget Shortfall

description: The Dominican Republic is designating more than a dozen Haitian gangs “terrorist organizations,” giving the Caribbean nation additional tools to stave off the chaos that’s plaguing its troubled neighbor.
title: Haitian Gangs Declared Terrorist Groups by Dominican Republic

description: Estar en medio del escándalo de criptomonedas que atrapó al presidente de uno de los países más grandes de Sudamérica no era la primera vez para los miembros de la familia Davis, que ya saben de controversias.
title: La oscura familia del emprendedor cripto que se cruzó con Milei

description: Administrators at New York City’s Barnard College are squaring off against student protesters for the first time since the Trump administration intensified scrutiny over the response to antisemitism on American campuses.
title: NYC's Barnard Clashes With Protestors as Trump Targets Antisemitism at Colleges

description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, senior writer for economics Shawn Donnan looks at how tariffs are playing with consumers. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: Trump’s Tariff Threats Draw Growing Consumer Backlash

description: Leaders of the European Union will call for increased flexibility in their funding rules to boost defense spending in the short term as the challenges posed by US President Donald Trump and Russia’s threat to the security of the continent are forcing a “once-in-a-generation” military build-up.
title: EU Leaders to Call for Flexible Use of EU Funds for Defense

description: The Elon Musk-led Department of Government Efficiency must present a representative to testify under oath at a deposition about the structure of the office, its authority and its work, a judge has ruled.
title: Judge Orders Musk’s DOGE, Agency Staff to Testify in Lawsuit

description: President Donald Trump said the US and the UK had restarted long-stalled trade talks after meeting British Prime Minister Keir Starmer at the White House.
title: Trump Backs US-UK Trade Talks After Meeting With Starmer in DC

description: Colombian Vice President Francia Márquez said her life is in danger for speaking out against corruption.
title: Colombian Vice President Márquez Says Her Life Is in Danger

description: Florida has no income tax, and now Governor Ron DeSantis is pushing a plan to eliminate the state’s property levies as well.
title: Florida’s DeSantis Pushes Unusual Plan to Abolish Property Taxes

description: Germany’s conservative CDU/CSU bloc under chancellor-in-waiting Friedrich Merz and the Social Democrats are set to start exploratory talks on a coalition on Friday, said people familiar with the matter.
title: Germany’s Merz to Start Exploratory Talks With Social Democrats on Friday

description: California Governor Gavin Newsom is enlisting veteran Republican lawmaker Ken Calvert to help push his $40 billion wildfire aid request through Congress and secure President Donald Trump’s backing for rebuilding efforts.
title: Newsom Leans on Veteran Republican to Push $40 Billion California Fire Aid

description: At least three government lawyers working on defending a major Biden-era drug pricing law were laid off in mass cuts across the agency this month, according to a source familiar with the terminations.
title: HHS Lays Off Lawyers Who Were Defending Medicare Drug Price Cuts

description: President Donald Trump sidestepped pressure to agree on providing a so-called “backstop” to any European peacekeeping force in Ukraine, saying the focus should first be on securing an end to Russia’s war, as he met with UK Prime Minister Keir Starmer.
title: Trump Says Premature to Talk Ukraine Backstop Before Deal Made

description: India has appointed Tuhin Kanta Pandey, the top bureaucrat in its Finance Ministry, to head the country’s capital markets regulator, according to a government notification Thursday.
title: India Names Top Finance Bureaucrat as Capital Markets Regulator

description: The nominee to become President Donald Trump’s chief White House economist defended his boss’s decision to charge ahead with duties on some of the US’s biggest trading partners, telling senators Thursday the country can have a “fabulous economy” even with high tariffs.
title: US Can Have ‘Fabulous Economy’ With Tariffs, Trump Adviser Says

description: President Donald Trump said he was inclined to support the British deal to cede control of the Chagos islands in the Indian Ocean, where the US and UK share a military base.
title: Trump Tells Starmer He’s Inclined to Back UK Deal on Chagos

description: Israel’s military admitted it underestimated and misread Hamas before the attack of Oct. 7, 2023, saying it thought the militant group had neither the intention nor the ability to carry out such a devastating operation.
title: Israeli Army Admits It Underestimated Hamas Before Oct. 7 Attack

description: As some of the world’s largest companies report earnings, one topic is dominating the conversation: tariffs.
title: Tariff Worries Surpass 2018 Levels, Dominating Earnings Season

description: Three developing nations’ leaders issued a rebuke of Israel’s execution of its war on Hamas in Gaza, and said US President Donald Trump’s proposal to annex the territory and deport all its citizens would be illegal and amount to “ethnic cleansing.”
title: Ramaphosa Joins Other Leaders to Slam Israel, Trump’s Gaza Plan

description: Africa’s first turn at hosting Group of 20 nations was pitched as a big push for development, but instead is witnessing wealthy economies pivot further toward arms over aid.
title: Arms Splurge Overshadows Aid at Africa’s First G-20 Presidency

description: European Union leaders at a meeting next week will discuss the appointment of a special envoy representing the bloc in possible negotiations around ending Russia’s invasion of Ukraine, according to people familiar with the matter.
title: EU to Consider Naming Special Envoy for Potential Ukraine Talks

description: A decade after establishing an outpost in Silicon Valley to speed adoption of commercial technology by the US military, the Pentagon still struggles to apply innovations to major strategic challenges, according to a new report by the Government Accountability Office.
title: Pentagon Still Falls Short on Jump-Starting Innovation, Audit Says

description: The Pentagon and the Navy have shelled out billions of dollars to the shipbuilding industry to improve construction of warships and support vessels but didn’t properly coordinate that spending or take a strategic approach toward contractors, according to a sweeping new assessment by Congress’s audit agency.
title: Navy Keeps Botching Shipbuilding and Modernization, Audit Warns

description: Colombia’s Gustavo Petro is expected to name Edwin Palma as the nation’s new energy minister following weeks of tumultuous changes inside his cabinet.
title: Colombia’s Petro Names Former Head of Oil Workers Union as Energy Minister

description: Stanford University is implementing a hiring freeze as colleges and universities across the US confront the threat of severe funding cuts from the Trump administration.
title: Stanford Freezes Hiring as Colleges Face Trump Funding Threat

description: A majority of respondents in a Harris Poll say the president’s tariff plans will increase the cost of everyday goods.
title: Trump Risks American Consumer Backlash Over Tariffs, Poll Shows

description: Romanian prosecutors have allowed self-described “misogynist” influencer Andrew Tate and his brother Tristan, who face rape and human trafficking charges, to leave for the US following pressure from the Trump administration.
title: Romania Allows Suspected Rapist Andrew Tate to Leave After US Lobbying

description: Finance ministers gathered in Cape Town for a meeting of the Group of 20 wealthy economies “expressed support” for South Africa’s theme of “Solidarity, Equality and Sustainability,” according to a summary of the proceedings.
title: G-20 Finance Chiefs Support South Africa’s Call for Solidarity

description: Goldman Sachs Group Inc. erased diversity targets from a key regulatory filing, becoming the latest Wall Street firm to turn away from specific goals for a more representative workforce after an executive order by President Donald Trump.
title: Goldman Sachs Removes Diversity Goals After Trump DEI Order

description: President Donald Trump said 25% tariffs on Canada and Mexico are on track to go into place on March 4, and said he would impose an additional 10% tax on Chinese imports.
title: Trump Says Canada, Mexico Tariffs to Take Effect, Adds New China Duty

description: Microsoft Corp. President Brad Smith is urging the Trump administration to rethink regulations that would cap the export of artificial intelligence chips to “strategically vital markets” including Israel and Switzerland.
title: Microsoft Urges Trump Administration to Relax Chip Export Curbs

description: Turkey, which has the second largest army in NATO after the US, is open to providing troops for a peacekeeping force in Ukraine, according to people familiar with the matter.
title: NATO-Member Turkey Open to Deploying Peacekeepers in Ukraine

description: Polish prosecutors brought charges against former Prime Minister Mateusz Morawiecki for overstepping his powers in attempting to organize a vote-by-mail during the coronavirus pandemic.
title: Poland Charges Former Nationalist Premier With Abuse of Power

description: Thailand deported 40 Uyghur asylum seekers to China on Thursday, drawing condemnation from international rights groups that denounced the move as a violation of international law.
title: Thailand Deports Dozens of Uyghurs to China, Sparking Outcry

description: When Elon Musk posted on X in December that the only thing that could “save Germany” was the AfD, he was embracing a political force that has moved steadily to the extreme right since it was founded in 2013.
title: The AfD Is Now Germany’s Main Opposition Party. Here’s What to Expect

description: A Vietnam court has sentenced independent journalist Truong Huy San to 30 months in prison for posting articles on Facebook that were critical of the government.
title: Vietnam Court Jails Journalist for 30 Months Over Facebook Posts

description: US President Donald Trump is close to striking a deal to grab a share of Ukraine’s natural resources as he pushes for an end to Russia’s three-year war in the country.
title: Why Trump Wants Ukraine’s Natural Resources and What’s Viable

description: The UK government has set out a path to approving an expansion of London’s Gatwick airport, despite an initial refusal from the planning authorities, as Labour tries to push ahead with major infrastructure projects in a bid to spur economic growth.
title: London Gatwick Airport Encouraged to Expand by UK Government

description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.
title: Romania Is Steamrollered by Global Trumpism

description: Grocery stores are promoting homegrown produce to consumers as 85% of Canadians hunt for alternatives to US goods.
title: ‘Buy Canada, Bye America’: Trump’s Taunts Spur Fury in the North

description: Hungary plans to impose profit curbs to contain soaring food prices that led to a resurgence of inflation a year before crucial elections.
title: Hungary to Impose Profit Curbs to Contain Soaring Food Prices

description: Indian officials are exploring ways to lower tariffs on a wide range of imports, including cars and chemicals, in a bid to evade US President Donald Trump’s threatened reciprocal levies, according to people familiar with the matter.
title: India Weighs Tariff Cuts on Cars, Chemicals as Trump Duties Loom

description: The US and Russia started talks in Istanbul to restore diplomatic staff in each other’s countries, Russian state news service Tass reported, a step by President Donald Trump to ease years of strained ties.
title: US, Russia Meet in Turkey in Early Step Toward Restoring Ties

description: Kurdish leader Abdullah Ocalan is expected to call on the separatist PKK group to lay down arms against Turkey, a potential turning point in a conflict that’s run for four decades.
title: Turkey Readies for Jailed PKK Leader’s Call on Kurdish Conflict

description: Russia is borrowing at the highest volumes on the domestic market since the start of the war in Ukraine as signs of a thaw in US relations boost demand for local assets.
title: US-Russia Talks Fuel Demand for Bonds That Fund Putin’s War

description: European Union President Ursula von der Leyen is likely to discuss preventing restricted technologies from places such as India reaching Russia in violation of sanctions when she visits the South Asian nation from Thursday, a top envoy said.
title: India and EU to Discuss Preventing Banned Goods From Going to Russia, Envoy Says

description: Ethiopian Prime Minister Abiy Ahmed traveled to neighboring Somalia for talks with President Hassan Sheikh Mohamud as the two nations mend ties strained by a dispute over Addis Ababa’s quest to gain access to a port.
title: Ethiopian Premier Visits Somalia to Mend Ties After Port Furor

description: Is Europe in a state of evaporation?
title: Goldman's Jared Cohen and George Lee on the Unprecedented Shocks in Geopolitics

description: A bipartisan group of US lawmakers is re-introducing a bill on Thursday that would authorize comprehensive trade talks with the UK, an effort to revive negotiations between the two allies as Prime Minister Keir Starmer was about to visit the White House.
title: Lawmakers Introduce UK-US Trade Bill Before Starmer Meets Trump
Odd Lots: Navigating Unprecedented Geopolitical Shocks (Podcast)

description: China said work on discussions with the US military are in their early stages, a development that could lead to an easing of tensions spurred by Beijing ramping up naval activity.
title: China Says Plans for Talks With US Military Are in the Works

description: Three moderate Austrian parties struck a deal to form a new government, moving ahead with a coalition which will need to make deep budget cuts in an economy trying to exit a second year of recession.
title: Austria’s Moderate Parties Seal Coalition to Sideline Far Right

description: South Africa wants to reach a broad-ranging agreement with the US on diplomacy and trade amid strained ties between the two nations, President Cyril Ramaphosa said.
title: South Africa Seeks ‘Meaningful Deal’ With US Amid Strained Ties

description: Kirill Dmitriev wrote on Elon Musk’s X platform for the first time since 2012 this week to declare US-Russia cooperation was “key to address world challenges.” Then he posted a video graphic depicting a joint mission to Mars with the US and Saudi Arabia on what appears to be one of Musk’s SpaceX rockets.
title: Putin Envoy Targets Trump and Musk to Lure US Into Ukraine Deal

description: European Union nations are likely to rally around common defense spending, as the region looks at ways to bolster its security, according to Spanish Economy Minister Carlos Cuerpo.
title: Spain Sees EU Members Rallying Around Common Defense Funds

description: Volodymyr Zelenskiy is heading to Washington Friday to sign a deal that will allow the US to tap into future revenue from the war-battered country’s natural resources.
title: Ukraine to Sign a Minerals Deal With Trump: Here Are the Details

description: Jailed MP Mike Amesbury will return to court to appeal against his sentence.
title: Jailed MP Mike Amesbury Back in Court to Appeal Against Sentence

description: A top security aide to Russian President Vladimir Putin held talks with Malaysian Prime Minister Anwar Ibrahim, as the Kremlin builds ties with Southeast Asian nations seeking to offset the risks of the growing competition between the US and China.
title: Putin’s Top Security Aide Extends Southeast Asia Push With Anwar Talks

description: The nation’s industrial giants believe clean technology is the best bet for the future. That should be an incentive for Friedrich Merz to stay the course on climate policy.
title: Don’t Sound the Death Knell for Germany’s Green Wave Yet

description: France is destroying its industrial base by over-taxation, Michelin Chief Executive Officer Florent Menegaux said, with a thinly veiled threat to take business elsewhere.
title: France Is ‘Killing’ Its Industry With Taxes, Michelin CEO Says

description: Donald Trump has made it clear that Europe needs to defend itself, and the continent’s response to the US threats of withdrawal is starting to take shape.
title: Trump Shocks Europe Into Chasing Billions for Military Buildup

description: Secretary of State Marco Rubio mapped out US strategy for managing Russia’s close relationship with China, saying Washington wants to dilute ties without sowing division between the nuclear-armed neighbors.
title: Rubio Says US Can’t Let Russia Become China’s ‘Junior Partner’

description: Australia’s ambitions to become a major producer of green hydrogen may follow a similar trajectory to the US’s move away from renewable energy if the government loses elections due by mid-May, according to project ratings agency HySights Pte Ltd.
title: Australia’s Green Hydrogen Outlook Seen Souring Before Elections

description: The Trump administration has canceled an upcoming meeting of the Food and Drug Administration’s vaccine advisory committee, a move that could complicate efforts to produce flu shots in time for the upcoming season.
title: Trump Administration Cancels Meeting of FDA Vaccine Advisers, Risking Flu-Shot Delay

description: North Korea has sent more than a thousand additional troops to Russia this year to help President Vladimir Putin’s war efforts against Ukraine, South Korea’s Yonhap News reported.
title: North Korea Sends More Troops to Russia to Support Putin’s War

description: Leadership at a key US weather and science agency is compiling a list of employees who didn’t respond to an email asking them to explain what they did last week, an infraction that both President Donald Trump and his billionaire adviser Elon Musk have said put the workers’ jobs at risk.
title: Musk Email Prompts Weather Agency to Compile Nonresponders List

description: Chief Justice John Roberts temporarily let President Donald Trump keep freezing foreign-aid payments while the US Supreme Court weighs whether to lift an order that would require disbursement of as much as $2 billion.
title: Supreme Court Temporarily Lets Trump Keep Foreign-Aid Freeze

description: US Director of National Intelligence Tulsi Gabbard called for an investigation and expressed concern after the UK government ordered Apple Inc. to build a backdoor into the global data of its customers.
title: Gabbard Calls for Investigation of UK’s Apple Backdoor Request

description: President Donald Trump asked the US Supreme Court to block a judge’s order that requires the immediate disbursement of as much as $2 billion in USAID humanitarian-assistance projects around the world.
title: Trump Asks Supreme Court to Let Foreign-Aid Freeze Continue

description: Britain will be hit by rising prices and severe bottlenecks as a result of the Labour government’s plans for an historic increase in building projects, analysis shows.
title: Labour’s Building Boom to Fan Inflation if UK Limits Migration
